intro: Maytenus cuezzoi, commonly known as the Colombian mayten, is a species of flowering plant in the family Phyllanthaceae. It is native to South America, particularly Colombia, and grows in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves, which are often alternate and have a feathery appearance. It produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by small, woody fruits. Maytenus cuezzoi is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along riverbanks.
